intro: Plocostemma lasianthum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved plocostemma, is a small flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are usually pale green or yellowish in color. It is an annual or short-lived perennial plant, often used in local horticulture for its ornamental value.
